div.head: Tablature Notation
div.p: This chapter describes the attribute classes that are part of the MEI.tablature module.

div.head: Overview of the Tablature Module
div.p: The tablature module is used to record tablature notation. This version is fairly basic, designed primarily for guitar and similar plucked-string instruments.

The lines attribute on the staffDef element is used to define the number of lines, courses, or strings, present in the tablature. The tab.strings attribute is then used to enumerate the pitches of the open string. It is important to note that this is given using the written pitch, not the sounding pitch. For example, the Western 6-string guitar, in standard tuning, sounds an octave below written pitch.
The tab.strings attribute gives the string tuning, ordered from highest to lowest pitch.
For standard guitar tuning, the staffDef element might look like this:

staffDef.tab.strings: e5 b4 g4 d4 a3 e3

div.p: Chromatic alteration may be indicated with the '-' or 'f' (flat), or the '#' or 's' (sharp). Multiple sharps and flats are not permitted.
A guitar in E flat tuning might look like this:

staffDef.tab.strings: ef5 bf4 gf4 df4 af3 ef3

div.p: Some instruments, like the 12-string guitar, have the four lowest strings tuned an octave above but are still written on a 6-line tablature staff. In this case, you may enumerate the open string pitches while maintaining 6 lines.

staffDef.tab.strings: e4 e3 a4 a3 d4 d3 g5 g4 b4 b4 e5 e5

div.p: The note element is then used to capture the specific events in the tablature. The tab.string attribute is used to capture which string the note is to be played on. String order is the same as that given in the tab.strings attribute. This attribute takes a positive integer in the range of 1-9.
In the case of fretted instruments, you may also capture the fret number with the tab.fret attribute. You may also capture the open string with an "o" value.
